content.text:
I'm Claude Code, ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans! 

Let me start by getting oriented in this environment. I can see I'm in a Tauri desktop application project at `/Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/packages/desktop/src-tauri`.

Let me explore the structure to understand what we're working with:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="execute_bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/packages/desktop/src-tauri</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="execute_bash">
<parameter name="command">cat /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/packages/desktop/src-tauri/Cargo.toml</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="execute_bash">
<parameter name="command">find /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent/packages/desktop/src-tauri/src -type f -name "*.rs" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

I'm warmed up and ready! I can see this is a Rust-based Tauri application for a desktop client. The git status shows some recent changes to icon assets.

When you're ready, please provide:
1. **Requirements**: What feature or change needs to be implemented?
2. **Perspective** (optional): Any specific approach or angle you'd like me to take when designing the solution?

I'll then explore the codebase thoroughly, understand the existing patterns, and create a detailed implementation plan for you - all in READ-ONLY mode, without making any file modifications.
